serial_killers.name: Ted Bundy
serial_killers.description: Ted Bundy was a notorious American serial killer who kidnapped, raped, and murdered more than 30 young women in the 1970s.

serial_killers.name: Aileen Wuornos
serial_killers.description: Aileen Wuornos was a female serial killer who murdered seven men in Florida in 1989 and 1990, claiming they had tried to assault her.

serial_killers.name: John Wayne Gacy
serial_killers.description: John Wayne Gacy was an American serial killer known for murdering at least 33 teenage boys and young men in the 1970s.

serial_killers.name: Jeffrey Dahmer
serial_killers.description: Jeffrey Dahmer, also known as the Milwaukee Cannibal, committed the murder and dismemberment of 17 men and boys between 1978 and 1991.

serial_killers.name: Harold Shipman
serial_killers.description: Dr. Harold Shipman was a British doctor who is believed to have killed over 200 of his patients by administering lethal doses of painkillers.

serial_killers.name: Ed Gein
serial_killers.description: Ed Gein was an American murderer and body snatcher whose crimes inspired numerous horror films, including 'Psycho' and 'The Texas Chainsaw Massacre.'

serial_killers.name: Gary Ridgway
serial_killers.description: Known as the Green River Killer, Gary Ridgway confessed to murdering 71 women in Washington State during the 1980s and 1990s.

serial_killers.name: Lizzie Borden
serial_killers.description: Lizzie Borden was famously tried and acquitted for the axe murders of her father and stepmother in 1892, becoming a figure of American folklore.
